action.action-desc: Mr. McNerney (for himself, Mr. Huffman, Ms. Speier, Mr. Garamendi, and Mr. Swalwell of California) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Natural Resources

form.official-title: To amend the Reclamation Wastewater and Groundwater Study and Facilities Act to authorize certain recycled water projects, and for other purposes.

section.header: Short title
section.text: This Act may be cited as the Western Water Recycling and Drought Relief Act.

section.header: Western recycled water project authorizations

subsection.text: The Reclamation Wastewater and Groundwater Study and Facilities Act (43 U.S.C. 390h et seq.) is amended by adding at the end the following:

section.header: Benicia water reuse project

subsection.text: The Secretary, in cooperation with the City of Benicia, California, is authorized to participate in the design, planning, and construction of recycled water system facilities.
The Federal share of the cost of the project authorized by this section shall not exceed 25 percent of the total cost of the project.
The Secretary shall not provide funds for the operation and maintenance of the project authorized by this section.
There is authorized to be appropriated to carry out this section $6,750,000.

In carrying out sections 1642 through 1648 of the Reclamation Wastewater and Groundwater Study and Facilities Act, and the sections added to such Act by subsection (a), the Secretary shall enter into individual agreements with the Western Recycled Water Coalition participating agencies to fund the projects, and shall include in such agreements a provision for the reimbursement of design, planning and construction costs, including those costs incurred prior to the enactment of this Act, subject to appropriations made available for the Federal share of the project under sections 1642 through 1648 of the Reclamation Wastewater and Groundwater Study and Facilities Act and the sections added to such Act by subsection (a).
